column4: hello! im  unable to boot my ubuntu 9.04, grub told me error 22 no such partition....
the live cd of ubuntu 8.04 told me that i have 2 media, the one with  ubuntu 9.04 and one little that i think is of ubuntu 8.04
i have deleted ubuntu 8.04 so the  grub is drunk.....
if you deleted the linux partition you probably need to reset your MBR aswell. Do you run linux at all now?
what do you have on your hard drive? Windows? Linux?
so you have ubuntu 9.04 only. But it doesnt work.
ok, and grub think you still have both.
alright.. i guess first thing would be to edit your menu.lst. i belive dutchbuntu pasted a good link for you. lets see
take a look at that one first. see if it can help you
you will have to know what harddrive and what partition you have your ubuntu 9.04 on.
ah.. your on a live cd. hm
i guess you will have to mount your ubuntu 9.04 partition first.
i dont think i ever used a live cd, im afraid i cant help you with that. Perhaps ActionParsnip or dutchbuntu can help you to edit menu.lst from the livecd.
look in your media sda1 directory. do you have a boot directory in there now?
